H0.text: What station is at the western end of the Ffestiniog railway in Wales. Pwllheli

H1.text: What station is at the western end of the Ffestiniog railway in Wales. Caernarfon

H2.text: What station is at the western end of the Ffestiniog railway in Wales. Bangor

H3.text: What station is at the western end of the Ffestiniog railway in Wales. Portmadoc

A4.text: The Festiniog Railway's Porthmadog Harbour railway station was originally only a shunting yard, but was upgraded to a full station on 6 January 1865.

A5.text: Until the line between Bangor and Afonwen closed in 1964 there was a through service in the summer to and from London Euston via Crewe, Chester, Llandudno Junction and Caernarfon; the Pwllheli portion was detached at Afonwen and the forward coaches proceeded to Portmadoc (as it was then known).
